title: Natalie Barr discovers mould in her 14-year-old son's school lunchbox
text:
She balances raising two teenage boys with presenting duties on Channel Seven breakfast show Sunrise.

And on Tuesday, newsreader Natalie Barr shared a glimpse of her less-than-glamorous home life in a video shared to Instagram.

The journalist, 51, filmed herself opening up her 14-year-old son Hunter's lunchbox, which was covered with mould.

Gross! Sunrise's Natalie Barr (right, with Sam Armytage) has discovered mould in her 14-year-old son's school lunchbox, sharing footage of her grisly discovery to Instagram on Tuesday

The mould was presumably the result of the bag's contents being left untouched and partially sealed for the entire school term.

'Two weeks? A term? Who knows,' she captioned the video, hinting that even she didn't know how long food had been left inside.

She added the hashtags, 'Kids are disgusting' and 'Get them back to school' .

Grim! Natalie filmed herself opening up her son's lunchbox, which was covered with mould

Natalie's fellow Sunrise host Sam Armytage was quick to comment below the post, writing 'OMG' alongside a nauseated-face emoji.

The Morning Show host Kylie Gillies, who also is the mother of two boys, wrote: 'No. Words.'

One of Natalie's Instagram followers suggested that a rotten apple was to blame for the extent of the mould.

Family life: Natalie is the proud mother of two sons, 18-year-old Lachlan and 14-year-old Hunter, whom she shares with her husband Andrew Thompson. Pictured on June 29, 2006

They wrote: '[It's a] shame because the rest of the lunchbox was so clean! It's definitely an apple and something else!'

Natalie is the proud mother of two sons, 18-year-old Lachlan and 14-year-old Hunter, whom she shares with her husband Andrew Thompson.

The couple married in 1995.
description: She balances raising two teenage boys with presenting duties on Channel Seven breakfast show Sunrise.
authors: Ali Daher For Daily Mail Australia
